decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and using cards like Goryo's Vengeance to bring them back onto the battlefield for a game-winning combo. With a mix of control elements like Force of Negation and Solitude, as well as efficient card draw and reanimation spells, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent while setting up the combo, leading to explosive turns and quick victories.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing a variety of multicolored creatures and powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Wild Nacatl and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while using Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt to deal direct damage and control the board. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support by boosting creature power and locking down opponent's threats. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion, adding extra versatility to the deck's mana base.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board while applying constant pressure with efficient creatures and Liliana of the Veil. The deck includes hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, along with removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes cards like The Rack and Dauthi Voidwalker to chip away at the opponent's life total. Urza's Saga provides additional threats, while Mishra's Factory can turn into a creature to further pressure the opponent. Castle Locthwain helps with card advantage and ensuring a steady stream of threats.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures such as Griselbrand using Goryo's Vengeance and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also has disruption in the form of cards like Thoughtseize and Faithful Mending to protect the combo. The deck seeks to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Grief and Tainted Indulgence to set up the reanimation combo. Solitude provides removal for threats, while Ephemerate can be used to protect key creatures or reuse their abilities. The deck is designed to efficiently bring back creatures and control the board to win the game.

The main concept of this deck revolves around assembling the Urza lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana to play powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes powerful board wipes like All Is Dust and Oblivion Stone to control the opponent's board while ramping into game-winning threats. The inclusion of cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying help to consistently find the Urza lands to ensure the deck's strategy is executed smoothly.

The deck focuses on using cards that cycle through the graveyard to eventually play Living End, a card that returns all creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck includes creatures with abilities that trigger when cycled or discarded, as well as counter spells to help protect the combo. The goal is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to bring them all back at once. The deck also includes lands that provide additional support or mana fixing for the combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing a toolbox of creature cards to create powerful combos and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By using cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Delighted Halfling, it can generate value and control the board. The deck also includes cards like Chord of Calling and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to search for specific creatures as needed. The key strategy is to use the creatures in combination with each other to create advantageous board states and win conditions.
